alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:24PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Columbia, northwestern Multnomah and southwestern Clark Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 523 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lewisville, or over Battle Ground, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Battle Ground, Portland, Vancouver, Scappoose, Ridgefield, La Center, Walnut Grove, Mount Vista, Venersborg, Hazel Dell North, Lake Shore, Dollar Corner, Five Corners, Hockinson, Salmon Creek, Cherry Grove, Barberton, Meadow Glade, Hazel Dell South and Lewisville. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 5 between mile markers 3 and 17. Interstate 205 between mile markers 33 and 37. State Route 503 between mile markers 2 and 18. In Oregon this includes U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 19 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia
